title: Mauricio Pochettino says he does not believe Spurs will make any January transfers
text:
Mauricio Pochettino has said he does not believe there will be any changes to his squad in January, insisting that he wants to “stick with” the current Tottenham Hotspur players.

Tottenham’s poor form this season, which included shipping 10 goals in their previous two matches, has led to accusations of staleness within the squad, many of whom have been at the club for years.

Pochettino has spoken of “disunity” within the squad this season but ahead of their meeting with Watford this weekend he said he has full faith in the existing group of players.

Asked if there will be changes to the team in January, Pochettino said: “No, I don’t believe [so]. Really. I believe in the players that we have, I believe in the players that are in Tottenham today.

“I respect all the opinions and for sure there are going to be people who say we need to change or we need to do something, in or out. If it is my decision I am going to stick with my players because I know they have the quality.

“It is only to unlock some situation that is always going on in their minds. We have the quality to be fighting for the things that we expect to fight for.”
description: Mauricio Pochettino has said he does not believe there will be any changes to his squad in January, insisting that he wants to “stick with” the current Tottenham Hotspur players.
